headline: Netflix Refinances Part of $59 Billion Loan for Warner Bros.
summary: The streaming giant got a $5 billion revolving credit facility and two $10 billion delayed-draw term loans to refinance part of the bridge facility it took out for its Warner Bros. bid, according to a filing on Monday.  Netflix agreed to a deal in early December that values Warner Bros.’ studio and streaming assets at $82.7 billion.

content.title: Netflix Refinances Part of $59 Billion Loan for Warner Bros.
content.summary: The streaming giant got a $5 billion revolving credit facility and two $10 billion delayed-draw term loans to refinance part of the bridge facility it took out for its Warner Bros. bid, according to a filing on Monday.  Netflix agreed to a deal in early December that values Warner Bros.’ studio and streaming assets at $82.7 billion.

headline: Larry Ellison gives $40.4 billion guarantee for Paramount's Warner Bros bid
summary: Oracle co-founder Larry Ellison has agreed to provide a personal guarantee of $40.4 billion in equity financing ​to back the all-cash bid by Paramount Skydance's bid for ‌Warner Bros Discovery, a regulatory filing showed on Monday.  The guarantee is expected to ‌bolster the deal financing terms, which was criticized by the board of Warner Bros while rejecting Paramount's bid in favor of Netflix.  Paramount said the amended terms do not change the $30-per-share all-cash offer.

content.title: Larry Ellison gives $40.4 billion guarantee for Paramount's Warner Bros bid
content.summary: Oracle co-founder Larry Ellison has agreed to provide a personal guarantee of $40.4 billion in equity financing ​to back the all-cash bid by Paramount Skydance's bid for ‌Warner Bros Discovery, a regulatory filing showed on Monday.  The guarantee is expected to ‌bolster the deal financing terms, which was criticized by the board of Warner Bros while rejecting Paramount's bid in favor of Netflix.  Paramount said the amended terms do not change the $30-per-share all-cash offer.

headline: PARAMOUNT AMENDS ITS SUPERIOR $30 PER SHARE ALL-CASH OFFER FOR WARNER BROS. DISCOVERY
summary: Paramount Skydance Corporation (NASDAQ: PSKY) ("Paramount") today has amended its $30 per share all-cash offer for Warner Bros. Discovery, Inc. (NASDAQ: WBD) ("WBD"), to address WBD's stated concerns regarding Paramount's superior offer. Paramount continues to offer to purchase, for $30 per share in cash, 100% of the outstanding shares of WBD, and therefore will assume all assets and liabilities of WBD.

content.title: PARAMOUNT AMENDS ITS SUPERIOR $30 PER SHARE ALL-CASH OFFER FOR WARNER BROS. DISCOVERY
content.summary: Paramount Skydance Corporation (NASDAQ: PSKY) ("Paramount") today has amended its $30 per share all-cash offer for Warner Bros. Discovery, Inc. (NASDAQ: WBD) ("WBD"), to address WBD's stated concerns regarding Paramount's superior offer. Paramount continues to offer to purchase, for $30 per share in cash, 100% of the outstanding shares of WBD, and therefore will assume all assets and liabilities of WBD.

headline: Ellison offers $40.4 billion guarantee to beef up Paramount's Warner Bros bid
summary: Oracle co-founder Larry Ellison will provide a personal guarantee of $40.4 billion in equity financing to back Paramount Skydance's all-cash $108.4 billion bid for Warner Bros Discovery, a regulatory filing showed on Monday.  The guarantee ​aims to address Warner Bros board's doubts over Paramount's deal financing and the lack of a full ‌backing from the Ellison family, which had led the company to prefer a cash-and-stock deal with Netflix.  Paramount said the amended terms do not change the $30-per-share all-cash ‌offer.

content.title: Ellison offers $40.4 billion guarantee to beef up Paramount's Warner Bros bid
content.summary: Oracle co-founder Larry Ellison will provide a personal guarantee of $40.4 billion in equity financing to back Paramount Skydance's all-cash $108.4 billion bid for Warner Bros Discovery, a regulatory filing showed on Monday.  The guarantee ​aims to address Warner Bros board's doubts over Paramount's deal financing and the lack of a full ‌backing from the Ellison family, which had led the company to prefer a cash-and-stock deal with Netflix.  Paramount said the amended terms do not change the $30-per-share all-cash ‌offer.

headline: Billionaire Ellison offers personal guarantee for son's bid for Warner Bros
summary: Oracle tech tycoon Larry Ellison is offering a $40.4 billion personal guarantee to back Paramount's hostile bid for Warner Bros.But Warner Bros last week described the Paramount offer as risky, saying it was backed by "an unknown and opaque revocable trust" and involved "no Ellison family commitment of any kind."

content.title: Billionaire Ellison offers personal guarantee for son's bid for Warner Bros
content.summary: Oracle tech tycoon Larry Ellison is offering a $40.4 billion personal guarantee to back Paramount's hostile bid for Warner Bros.But Warner Bros last week described the Paramount offer as risky, saying it was backed by "an unknown and opaque revocable trust" and involved "no Ellison family commitment of any kind."

headline: Paramount’s new, hostile offer to Warner Bros. Discovery: Larry Ellison will personally guarantee $40 billion
summary: Paramount has upped the ante in its hostile takeover bid for Warner Bros. Discovery, announcing Monday that Larry Ellison will personally guarantee the tens of billions of dollars he is putting up to bankroll the transaction. The Ellisons will also let shareholders peer into the finances of their family trust.

content.title: Paramount’s new, hostile offer to Warner Bros. Discovery: Larry Ellison will personally guarantee $40 billion
content.summary: Paramount has upped the ante in its hostile takeover bid for Warner Bros. Discovery, announcing Monday that Larry Ellison will personally guarantee the tens of billions of dollars he is putting up to bankroll the transaction. The Ellisons will also let shareholders peer into the finances of their family trust.

headline: Warner Bros bidding war and red hot M&A market has dealmakers working through holidays
summary: A flurry of multi-billion-dollar deals has bankers and advisers from Wall Street to Canary Wharf packing laptops next to presents and warning family and friends their holiday vacations over the next two weeks will be cut short.  There have been $463.6 billion ​in mergers and acquisitions announced this month, 30% more than last year, including Trump Media & Technology Group's $6 billion merger with nuclear fusion firm TAE Technologies, IBM's $11 ‌billion purchase of data infrastructure company Confluent and a bidding war between Paramount Skydance and Netflix for Warner Bros Discovery, according to data compiled by Dealogic.

content.title: Warner Bros bidding war and red hot M&A market has dealmakers working through holidays
content.summary: A flurry of multi-billion-dollar deals has bankers and advisers from Wall Street to Canary Wharf packing laptops next to presents and warning family and friends their holiday vacations over the next two weeks will be cut short.  There have been $463.6 billion ​in mergers and acquisitions announced this month, 30% more than last year, including Trump Media & Technology Group's $6 billion merger with nuclear fusion firm TAE Technologies, IBM's $11 ‌billion purchase of data infrastructure company Confluent and a bidding war between Paramount Skydance and Netflix for Warner Bros Discovery, according to data compiled by Dealogic.

thumbnail.caption: FILE PHOTO: The Warner Bros. studio lot in California

headline: Ellison steps in with personal guarantee as Paramount fights for Warner Bros
summary: Oracle co-founder Larry Ellison has stepped in to personally guarantee $40.4 billion in Paramount Skydance's latest effort to pry Warner Bros Discovery away from selling its prized Hollywood assets to streaming giant Netflix.  The guarantee, disclosed in ​a filing on Monday, seeks to allay the Warner Bros board's doubts about Paramount's financing and the lack of full ‌Ellison family backing, which had pushed it toward the competing cash-and-stock offer from Netflix.

content.title: Ellison steps in with personal guarantee as Paramount fights for Warner Bros
content.summary: Oracle co-founder Larry Ellison has stepped in to personally guarantee $40.4 billion in Paramount Skydance's latest effort to pry Warner Bros Discovery away from selling its prized Hollywood assets to streaming giant Netflix.  The guarantee, disclosed in ​a filing on Monday, seeks to allay the Warner Bros board's doubts about Paramount's financing and the lack of full ‌Ellison family backing, which had pushed it toward the competing cash-and-stock offer from Netflix.

thumbnail.caption: David Ellison, CEO of Paramount Skydance, exits following an interview at the NYSE in New York

headline: Paramount Stock Rallies After Amended Warner Offer. The Ellisons Are All-In on the Deal.
summary: Paramount Skydance  amended its offer for  Warner Bros. Discovery  on Monday, guaranteeing the backing of  Oracle  founder Larry Ellison following the rejection last week of its hostile bid.  Paramount said in a news release that it wouldn’t be raising its offer of $30 a share for all of Warner Discovery.  “Our $30 per share, fully financed all-cash offer was on Dec. 4, and continues to be, the superior option to maximize value for WBD shareholders… We expect the board of directors of WBD to take the necessary steps to secure this value-enhancing transaction and preserve and strengthen an iconic Hollywood treasure for the future,” David Ellison said.

content.title: Paramount Stock Rallies After Amended Warner Offer. The Ellisons Are All-In on the Deal.
content.summary: Paramount Skydance  amended its offer for  Warner Bros. Discovery  on Monday, guaranteeing the backing of  Oracle  founder Larry Ellison following the rejection last week of its hostile bid.  Paramount said in a news release that it wouldn’t be raising its offer of $30 a share for all of Warner Discovery.  “Our $30 per share, fully financed all-cash offer was on Dec. 4, and continues to be, the superior option to maximize value for WBD shareholders… We expect the board of directors of WBD to take the necessary steps to secure this value-enhancing transaction and preserve and strengthen an iconic Hollywood treasure for the future,” David Ellison said.

headline: Ellison offers personal guarantee to beef up Paramount's Warner Bros bid
summary: Oracle co-founder Larry Ellison has stepped in to personally guarantee $40.4 billion in Paramount Skydance's latest effort to pry Warner Bros Discovery away from selling its prized Hollywood assets to streaming ​giant Netflix.  The guarantee, disclosed in a filing on Monday, seeks to allay the Warner Bros board's doubts about Paramount's ‌financing and the lack of full Ellison family backing, which had pushed it toward the competing cash-and-stock offer from Netflix.  Warner Bros shares rose about 3%, ‌while Paramount added over 7%.

content.title: Ellison offers personal guarantee to beef up Paramount's Warner Bros bid
content.summary: Oracle co-founder Larry Ellison has stepped in to personally guarantee $40.4 billion in Paramount Skydance's latest effort to pry Warner Bros Discovery away from selling its prized Hollywood assets to streaming ​giant Netflix.  The guarantee, disclosed in a filing on Monday, seeks to allay the Warner Bros board's doubts about Paramount's ‌financing and the lack of full Ellison family backing, which had pushed it toward the competing cash-and-stock offer from Netflix.  Warner Bros shares rose about 3%, ‌while Paramount added over 7%.

headline: Larry Ellison guarantees $40.4 billion in Paramount's hostile bid for Warner Bros. Discovery
summary: Paramount is sweetening its hostile takeover bid for Warner Bros. Discovery with an “irrevocable personal guarantee” from Larry Ellison, who is putting up billions of dollars to back the deal for his son’s company.  On Monday, Skydance-owned Paramount announced that Larry Ellison — the founder of Oracle and father of Paramount CEO David Ellison — had personally agreed to be responsible for $40.4 billion of equity financing for the company's offer, as well as any damage claims.  Paramount had previously said that the Ellison family trust would be backing more than $40 billion of its bid for Warner.

content.title: Larry Ellison guarantees $40.4 billion in Paramount's hostile bid for Warner Bros. Discovery
content.summary: Paramount is sweetening its hostile takeover bid for Warner Bros. Discovery with an “irrevocable personal guarantee” from Larry Ellison, who is putting up billions of dollars to back the deal for his son’s company.  On Monday, Skydance-owned Paramount announced that Larry Ellison — the founder of Oracle and father of Paramount CEO David Ellison — had personally agreed to be responsible for $40.4 billion of equity financing for the company's offer, as well as any damage claims.  Paramount had previously said that the Ellison family trust would be backing more than $40 billion of its bid for Warner.

headline: Ellison offers $40 billion to beef up Paramount's Warner Bros bid
summary:
STORY: :: Oracle Handout

Billionaire Larry Ellison has thrown his weight behind the latest effort by Paramount Skydance to buy Warner Bros Discovery... ratcheting up the industry’s most closely watched takeover battle.

The Oracle cofounder and father of Paramount Skydance CEO David Ellison on Monday said he will personally guarantee more than $40 billion for the deal...

in an effort to pry Warner Bros Discovery away from selling its prized assets to rival bidder Netflix.

The guarantee, disclosed in a Monday filing, sent shares of Paramount soaring as much as 8% in morning trading.

It comes after Warner Bros last week asked its shareholders to reject Paramount’s more than $108 billion offer for the company, including its cable TV assets.

The bid had raised doubts over its financing and the lack of a full guarantee from the Ellison family.

Paramount said the amended terms do not change its $30-per-share all-cash offer for Warner Bros.

It also agreed to raise the fee it would pay if the deal was blocked by regulators from $5 billion to $5.8 billion, matching Netflix's offer.

Meanwhile, lawmakers from both parties have voiced concerns about consolidation in the media industry.

A Paramount-Warner Bros merger would create a studio larger than industry leader Disney and combine two major television operators, a move some Democratic senators say would give one company control over "almost everything Americans watch on TV."

A Netflix-Warner Bros tie-up would cement Netflix's dominance in streaming, creating a company with a combined 428 million subscribers.
